greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of binary words of length n with cuts-resistance k.
comment: For the operation of shortening all runs by 1, cuts-resistance is defined to be the number of applications required to reach an empty word.
link: Claude Lenormand, Deux transformations sur les mots, Preprint, 5 pages, Nov 17 2003.
example: Row n = 4 counts the following words:
xref: Column k = 2 appears to be 2 * A027383.
The version for runs-resistance is A319411 or A329767.
The cuts-resistance of the binary expansion of n is A319416(n).
The version for compositions is A329861.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 23 2019
